page.title: 06Painthorpe House-1700
page.content: Painthorpe house was built during the 1700's and was the Vicarage to Chapelthorpe Curch before becoming a country club. There is an old wall running around the grounds and a gate way shows where the main entrance once was. Inside, the grounds have been converted into a golf course and the convertion took place during the 1900's. At the back of the club, an out-building has been converted into a canine beautitions and a hairdressing salon. although an extension has been added to hte front of the building, the origional building is still used and a gas lamp and several coloured pain windows are traces of the old house. On the second floor of the club is a store room. An outside staircase, which is reached by old stone steps, leads to the store room which is said to be haunted.
